titles.title: Providing for consideration of the Senate amendment to the bill (H.R. 3090) to provide tax incentives for economic recovery.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 107-367, by Ms. Pryce (OH).

It shall be in order to take from the Speaker's table the bill H.R. 3090 with the Senate amendment thereto, and to consider in the House a motion to agree to the Senate amendment, with a further amendment. The motion shall be debatable for one hour, equally divided and controlled.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 129.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 360.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 217 - 192 (Roll no. 51).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 3/6/2002--Reported to House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of the Senate amendment to H.R. 3090 (economic recovery tax incentives and temporary extended unemployment compensation).
